data.title: [Feature request] Getting global transform of a bone should be easier.
data.body:
Urho bones have "local global" namespace, so they are really hard to work with when something complex concerned.
Some method on Bone is needed to get actual global transform or transform in Skeleton node space.
As I have to write this code every now and then and see people asking about this, I think it is first serious
beginner's obstacle with Urho, which really confuses people. Also this one is easy enough to implement.
Also reversed method (converting global space/skeleton space to bone space) should be very nice to have too.

data.title: Proper new project setup?
data.body:
So far, i've been toying around with Lua scripts and the Urho3D player, in order to understand the engine and learn from the docs and examples. However, i'm now planning to start working on the actual project, but i'm not sure how to start:

* Is there a sample CMakeLists.txt file for new Urho3D-based projects?
* Can i link Urho3D statically? 
* Where i should keep my assets? What about my shaders?

data.title: 64bit integer variant
data.body: Title ^. Please make sure i did not forget anything here.

data.title: Invisible items in DropDownList
AbstractFile class
data.body:
Added AbstractFile class. It is used as parent class for classes that implement both Serializer and Deserialized.

While doing profiler work i found a need to interact with objects that implement both `Serializer` and `Deserializer`. Urho3D has several such objects but all of them inherit both classes separately. That means there is no way to have type system require an object implementing both. For this reason `AbstractFile` class was created and objects that inherited both `Serializer` and `Deserializer` now inherit `AbstractFile` instead.

Rename CheckDrawableVisibility() to CheckDrawableVisibilityWork() to …

data.title: Using Recast navigation in 2D case
data.body:
For now, as I see in NavigationMesh.cpp, only 3D objects are taken into account when collecting geometries for navigation mesh.

`if (drawable->GetType() == StaticModel::GetTypeStatic())`
`    info.lodLevel_ = static_cast<StaticModel*>(drawable)->GetOcclusionLodLevel();`
`else if (drawable->GetType() == TerrainPatch::GetTypeStatic())`
`    info.lodLevel_ = 0;`
`else`
`    continue;`

only static 3D models and terrains. Is there any quick solution on how to use empty 2D space top-down as a passable area, and any staticModel2D as an obstacles?

data.title: Extract some code to increase reusability.
data.body:
Main change here is in 4th commit of this PR.
I wanted to allow change paths on-the-fly with the same semantic as they are initialized.
I intentionally didn't add force ResourceCache force cleanup because it can be easlily done outside.

@cadaver, please check for important things that I may have missed.

**Note for reviewers**: it's easier to review changes in Engine.cpp via https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/1832/commits/f386678667396b342bc40a9ba9a52154914452e3

data.title: Extract Graphic Engine
data.body:
Hi everyone,

We're currently developping an app in C#, using WPF on Windows, and MonoMac for OSX. We now need to add a 3D view for our project, and were looking out to use Urho, as it seems really interesting. 
The thing is, we don't need to integrate every part of the Engine, only the Graphic engine would be enough.
Does anyone knows a way to extract the Graphic Engine, or just have another way around to use Urho Graphic Engine inside our app ?
The way it seems to work is that we have to integrate our app into Urho, not Urho into our app.

Thanks

data.title: (Feature request) Event between Renderer::Render() and UI:Render()
iModelMatrix semicolon
data.body:
If I understand correctly, semicolons is added to defines intentionally and deprecate using iModelMatrix in expressions

Transform.hlsl
```
#if defined(SKINNED)
    #define iModelMatrix GetSkinMatrix(iBlendWeights, iBlendIndices); // SEMICOLON
#elif defined(INSTANCED)
    #define iModelMatrix iModelInstance
#else
    #define iModelMatrix cModel
#endif
```

But it seems in Transform.glsl semicolon is missing
```
#if defined(SKINNED)
    #define iModelMatrix GetSkinMatrix(iBlendWeights, iBlendIndices) // ?????????
#elif defined(INSTANCED)
    #define iModelMatrix GetInstanceMatrix(); // SEMICOLON
#else
    #define iModelMatrix cModel
#endif
```

data.title: Canvas (feature req)
data.body:
There is 2 video: http://dropmefiles.com/zMB6J
Canvas in Unity and Renderer2D in Urho3D

Alghoritm of rendering in Unity:
1) Draw solid geometry
2) Disable depth write, but depth test still enabled
3) Draw 2D elements in correct order (firs elemets in list always rendered first)

Urho3D sort 2D elements by distance to camera and they can be flickering depending on the position of the camera.

Is easy way to imitate Unity canvas behavior in Urho?

data.title: Update Assimp
data.body: Unfortunately, as of Assimp 3.3 the developers have switched to C++11 and does not provide any pre-C++11 fallback paths. Reversing that would take some time and effort, so I've only updated to the latest release which still sticks with C++03 and here's a PR for that.

data.title: Editor.bat loading wrong files when modifying Editor scripts
data.body:
I've built Urho3D from the current source using CLion, so my project structure looks like so:

- Urho3D
   - ...
   - bin
   - cmake-build-debug
   - Source
   - ...

After building, I copied `Urho3DPlayer_d.exe` from `Urho3D/cmake-build-debug/bin` into `Urho3D/bin` and then began editing Editor files in `Urho3D/bin/Data/Scripts/Editor`. On initial load, files are loaded from the correct paths. But after editing a script and saving it, the Editor reloads files from `Urho3D/cmake-build-debug/bin` instead of from `Urho3D/bin`.

This can be reproduced by placing a call to `Print` in `CreateUI ` of `Urho3D/bin/Data/Scripts/Editor/EditorUI.as` and `Urho3D/cmake-build-debug/bin/Data/Scripts/Editor/EditorUI.as`  and then looking at the output in the Editors console.

By the way, removing the `cmake-build-debug` directory seems to fix this issue. So it sounds like Urho3DPlayer is searching parent directories for the first `Data` directory?

data.title: 32_Urho2DConstraints: objects vibrate when its dragged by mouse
Add Urho3DFwd.h header
data.body:
Some time ago `Urho3DAll.h` was introduced (and I've never used it for obvious reasons).
I think that header with forward declarations would be also useful.
I understand that genration algorithm would be much more complex and manual enumeration is error-prone on the other hand.
However, let this issue be here.

```

    }
```

data.title: (feature request) Separate option for AssetImporter
data.body: I never use AssetImporter (only blender exporter), but compiling of AssetImporter take half compile time. It would be nice to have option like "-DAsset_Importer=OFF".

data.title: Add custom "spans" to attribute and object animation
data.body:
Spans, are arbitrary things that perform animation within the duration of their "span."

Additionally, expose the attribute/object animation to access for tools.

data.title: Add skeleton and bone support to custom geometry
data.body:
RFC:

RFC is more for the API then how it is submitted. I've had to do this for SprueKit as it's largely an animation tool for generalized space animation.

The implementation just switches on the presence of inverse-bind matrices and lists of bone matrices, if they're present then custom geometry renders like an animated mesh, otherwise it renders as is.
